column4: My network configuration (laptop) hangs for a long time at boot. My guess is it tries to activate eth0 (wireless) even thou it is disabled in /etc/network/interfaces. Can anyone help - it's very annoying
and manually ifup it. I know - still very annoying
and you're sure it's not just trying to find an access point?
not sure - nothing in lsmo seem relevant
probably this 0000:02:04.0 Network controller: Intel Corp.: Unknown device 4223 (rev 05)
well... I don't know if what you're seeing is really a bug or not.
I don't think the system should try to start eth0, if ny interfaces file says 'auto lo eth1'
it's probaly not something that shold be filed on ipw2200's bug tracker, then.
